Selected Answer: B
vSmart

The vSmart controller is the brain of the overlay network, establishing, adjusting, and
maintaining the connections that form the fabric of the overlay network. In these functions, it
oversees the control plane of the Cisco SD-WAN overlay network. The vSmart controller
participates only in the overlay network and has no direct peering relationships with any of
the devices that an edge router is connected to on the host-facing side.

First answer and question goes to me. Ive been studying this exam for about a month. Ive read the 13 chapters in the official press book and watched the udemy video for this exam. I also happen to be hands on with this technology. I'm not saying I know all the answers. I'm just doing my best here. Happy studies and good luck!

oversees the control plane <<< vSmart. if you see control plane with NAT-T, think vBond.

questions.question_text:
Which component of the Cisco SD-WAN architecture oversees the control plane of overlay network to establish, adjust, and maintain the connections between the
WAN Edge devices that form the Cisco SD-WAN fabric?
Which port is used for vBond under controller certificates if no alternate port is configured?

discussion.content: Yes. Port 12346 is the right answer.

Selected Answer: D
Correct
Correct. Straight from the press book.

C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/segmentation/vEdge-20-x/segmentation-book/segmentation.html
C is correct.

C is correct.

vSmart-1# config
Entering configuration mode terminal
vSmart-1(config)# policy vpn-membership dissallow-vpn-1
vSmart-1(config-vpn-membership-dissallow-vpn-1)# sequence 10
vSmart-1(config-sequence-10)# match
vSmart-1(config-match)# ?
Possible completions:
 vpn VPN ID
 vpn-list Name of VPN list
 ---
Guys, C is the right answer because, vpn-id was an older option available in Cisco SD-WAN which now has been removed.

comments.content: s the given answer is correct C for me

discussion.content: cant be A because the VPN list that matches VPN 10 and 20 is being rejected. the default action is accept so, it is accepting anything but 10 and 20
A is the most appropriate answer among the given choices, even if it has the wrong VPNs of 10 & 20 instead of 1 (whether a typo or intentional, I can't tell)

C: there are 2 ways to configure the vpn membership. With a policy as shown in C, or by identifying them in the same line as the sites under apply-policy like this "vSmart (config-apply-policy)# site-list 20-30 vpn-membership 1.

The doc is not wrong, its just the original way of configuring the policy and identifying the vpn group of interest. Which is VPN1 in this scenario.

https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/config-17-2.pdf#
A is the correct answer
Dbla provided doc.

C isn't correct either. match vpn-id 1 is not a correct configuration command. The correct one would be match vpn 1. Unfortunately even the config guide contains this faulty line (https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/config-17-2.pdf#page=190), but vedge will drop an error if you try it. For the exam, however, C should be marked.
correct.

Selected Answer: A
the QoS configuration process is to assign traffic flows coming from the service-side to the appropriate forwarding classes. We can do this with either a centralized data policy on a per-VPN basis or with a localized data policy on a per-interface basis. Classification and Marking can be done at different network layers:

 Layer 2: 802.1q, MPLS EXP
 Layer 3: IP precedence, DSCP, IP ECN, Source/Destination IP
 Layer 4: TCP/UDP ports
 Layer 7: DPI/NBAR

Selected Answer: D
it should be use centralized data policy configure forward policy. local data policy is for QoS ..

granular QOS for app or prefixes is configured on - localized data policy
